para: This filter modifies any tracks so that either the distance or the time between consecutive points is no less than the specified interval. Where points are missing, the filter fills them in by following a straight line (actually a great circle) between the adjacent points. You must specify either the "distance" or the "time" option.
screen: gpsbabel -i gpx -f track.gpx -x interpolate,time=10 -o gpx -f newtrack.gpx
para: Reads track.gpx and inserts points wherever two adjacent trackpoints are more than 10 seconds apart
screen: gpsbabel -i gpx -f track.gpx -x interpolate,distance=15k -o gpx -f newtrack.gpx
para: Reads track.gpx and inserts points wherever two adjacent trackpoints are more than 15 kilometers apart
screen: gpsbabel -i gpx -f track.gpx -x interpolate,distance=2m -o gpx -f newtrack.gpx
para: Reads track.gpx and inserts points wherever two adjacent trackpoints are more than 2 miles apart
